result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon D. Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Participate in the CARE Program.  Defendant has 10 days credit if probation revoked.       ALL FINES/COSTS TO BE PAID THRU CLERK OR COURTS.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Brandon D. Hughes by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE explains nonappearance/says someone in DA's office told him he didn't need to appear on 10/6.  State responds and requests $500 cash bond citing prior warrant. Return date scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
